page.title: 12WOODLAND IN THE RIB VALLEY.
page.content: There are several areas of woodland in the Rib valley. Many of these are of ancient origin. For example{"Gardiners {Spring"}near Swangles' Farm was named after a local family. Today it is only a small wood,but it was once much larger. It is inhabited by pheasants, partridges,hares and rabbits,which are kept for shooting.{"Buckney Wood"}near Cold Christmas is one of the larger woods. It is mainly deciduous,with a narrow footpath running through the middle.{"Sawtrees Wood"}near Barwick ford is also deciduous and has been coppiced in the past. Today it isn't managed and is very overgrown,making it popular for walking and picnics. {Dutch Elm Disease}has hit the Rib valley badly. The track leading to Thundridge old church (called "the Causeway")used to be lined with elms, but these have all been destroyed.
